q: to Be Rude, But..." in which he laid down five important principles that actors can use when auditioning. 1. Don't grovel when you come in. Simon Cowell writes I look upon it[ groveling] as a sign of desperation. So many times people come in and they come up with this terrible dialogue about how much they like me or Randy or Paula. It's demeaning, and there's no point to it. We're not looking for a nice person; we're looking for somebody who's confident and assured, but talented above all. Trust me-- most stars aren't nice. 2. Believe in yourself the second you leave the house. "Self-possession isn't something you can turn on seconds before you walk into the audition room. People like Ruben or Kelly

TMZ.Com cites sources connected with the Super Bowl broadcast tell( TMZ) Simon Cowell will appear in a 30-second commercial during Sunday's big game... promoting his new talent show X Factor.*** Singer Cheryl Cole will not give up on her bid to make it in the US even if she fails to land a judging role on the US X Factor. on the right thumb he badly sprained less than two weeks ago, he scored 17 of Philadelphia's last 26 points. "I was just trying to take what the defense gave me," Allen Iverson said. I didn't want to be overaggressive. I just wanted to let my teammates do what they had to do early in the game because they( Grizzlies) were taking away some of the shots I wanted by zoning up. My teammates held the fort, and then when I got an opportunity, I just tried to make the best of it. Allen Iverson made 10-of-24 shots, including 4-of-7 3-pointers. He added six assists and three steals and confounded the Grizzlies with his quickness. The 76ers never trailed over the last three quarters but played fast and loose with the

Senator Kirsten Gillibrand echoed the mayor's call for gun control. Each also mentioned the recent Arizona shootings. Christine Quinn paraphrased Mavy Stodard, who was shielded from the gunman's fire by her husband who died. He gave his life, so that I could live, Christine Quinn said, summarizing Stodard's words at her husband's funeral Sunday. "And it will be very hard to go on without him. But I have to honor what he did, and live my life
